com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.evaluate

Class ResourceLabels

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.evaluate.ResourceLabels

  • class ResourceLabels
extends java.lang.Object
    Pairs a ResourceSpec definition with an existing task's labels associated with that resource.

      • ResourceLabels

      • ResourceLabels

        ResourceLabels(ResourceSpec original,
               ResourceSpec updated,
               java.lang.String resourceId,
               java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> resourceNamespace,
               java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> persistenceId,
               java.util.Optional<Protos.ResourceProviderID> providerId,
               java.util.Optional<Protos.Resource.DiskInfo.Source> diskSource,
               java.util.Optional<java.lang.String> frameworkId)
        ResourceLabels are used to map ServiceSpec entities to resources which have actually been consumed. Generally speaking there should be no difference between the resources from a Mesos perspective and the resources from a ServiceSpec perspective.

        There is one special case in which they differ, MOUNT volume resources. In this case the ResourceSpec and actually consumed resources differ in value. Because MOUNT volumes are atomic if the ResourceSpec indicates a need for 25 GB of disk and 50 GB of disk are actually offered, then 50 GB must be consumed.

        To capture this change the concept of an "updated" ResourceSpec is needed. We modify the ResourceSpec in this scenario to match the actually consumed resources to facilitate consistent protobuf construction.
